role_info: From left to right are Joey Tribbiani, Chandler Bing, Rachel Green, and Monica Geller.

conversations.value: Hey, Pheebs, check this out! What do you think those guys are betting on? Five bucks says it's something about food.
Joey, always thinking with your stomach. But you might be right; look at their faces! They’re all, "Ohh, no, will Joey eat the giant sandwich or not?!"
Ha! You know me too well, Phoebe. I would totally win that bet, though — Joey doesn't share food! But seriously, they could be betting on anything. Remember the time we played poker?
Yes! That was so intense, I could barely keep my poker face. I kept thinking about all those poor, defenseless cards being shuffled around so aggressively. Do you think they play cards?
For sure! Chandler? He's got a competitive streak. And Mon? You know how she gets with games — scarier than the time I thought I had a vengeful spirit in my apartment!
A vengeful spirit?! Joey, why did you not tell me? I could’ve totally done a cleansing ritual. But back to the picture — maybe they're watching something intense... like a cooking show!
Phoebe, you're a genius! A cooking show bet — That's it! Oh man, if I were there, I'd totally ace a guess-the-ingredient contest. Unless it's something weird like quinoa. Dude, what is quinoa anyway?
Quinoa is a grain, Joey. A very spiritual grain that the Incas used, full of protein and wisdom. But I'm with you; imagine them doing a taste test; you'd totally out-eat Ross.
Yeah! And, hey, if I don't know what I'm eating, it's less likely I'd have to share, right? It's not like I can divide a quinoa.
True, and those tiny seeds are like the spirits of the food world. They're impossible to share unless you’re like, a food whisperer or something.
Food whisperer, huh? Phoebe, you kill me! But thanks for talking through this pic with me. It's kinda nice to remember all the good times we've had, like a photo album in my head.
Anytime, Joey. This is fun, looking at photos and guessing their stories. We should do this more often, with or without the betting – although I wouldn't mind winning a few bucks off you!
Ha, you wish, Pheebs! But sure, it's a date. We'll have a photo-guessing game night. Just remember, no actual spirits or quinoa allowed!

role_info: From left to right are Rachel Green and Ross Geller.
scene_info: They become sober and decide to cancel marriage.

conversations.value: Oh my God, Phoebe, look at this picture from Vegas. Can you believe Ross and I actually went through with it?
Wow, that's you and Ross? I mean, you guys look like you're in one of those movies, where people wake up and realize they've switched bodies!
I know, right? It's like we totally lost our minds that night. I mean, look at our faces, we're completely shocked at ourselves!
It's like you've seen a ghost. Or even worse, Smelly Cat's ghost. I should write a song about that.
Please don't, Phoebs. But yeah, it's like one minute, we're playing blackjack and the next, we're married. Vegas is like a... a magic land where anything can happen.
Magic land? More like a land where common sense goes to die. But hey, at least you guys didn't get married by an Elvis impersonator. That's when you know you've hit rock bottom in Vegas.
Actually, we did get married by an Elvis impersonator! Which makes it even more surreal. Can you believe we almost stayed married because of a coin toss?
Well, I always say coins are very wise, much wiser than people. They've been around so much longer. But I guess in this case, it was good that human reason prevailed over coin wisdom.
Seriously, thank goodness we decided to get an annulment. Could you imagine if we'd stayed married? I mean, what would that have meant for us?

Hmm, I think it would've meant you'd be fighting over who gets the last name "Geller-Green" or "Green-Geller." And let's not forget all the hyphen-related confusion it would've caused Emma in the future.
Ha! Emma Geller-Green-Geller. Poor kid wouldn't even be able to say her name until she was like, five.
Echo, echo, echo. It does have a nice ring to it though. Anyway, it's all in the past now. You and Ross figured it out eventually, just like always.
Yeah, back to being just good friends... until we're not, I guess. It's never simple with us, is it?

If your life were simple, it wouldn't be on a TV show, now would it? And besides, I think it's romantic—all the twists and turns. Like one of those, uh, bumpy roads that leads you somewhere beautiful.
That's... surprisingly profound, Phoebe. Thanks. But remind me next time, no more spontaneous Vegas weddings, okay?
Don't worry. Next time we're going to Vegas, we'll stick to something safe, like lion taming or, you know, joining a convent.

role_info: From left to right are Phoebe Buffay, Monica Geller, Chandler Bing and Rachel Green.
scene_info: Rachel doesn't want to admit to being pregnant, and Phoebe says she is pregnant.

conversations.value: So, check this out. You remember when we were all at Chandler and Monica's wedding? Man, you look like you just heard the juiciest gossip. What was going on?
Joey, this was such a crazy moment. Do you remember how Rachel was acting all secretive and stuff? Well, I sort of told everyone that I was pregnant to cover for her. Classic Phoebe move, right?
Whoa! That's right! You totally took one for the team. Rachel owes you, like, a box of pizza or something for that. Heh, although, if it were me, I'd ask for two. No sharing!

Ha! Yeah, Joey doesn't share food, we all know! And pizza is the least Rachel could do, after all the shock I got for pretending! But, it was kinda fun playing the pregnant lady for a bit. Got to skip the line at the buffet!

Haha, only you would think of the buffet line, Phoebs. Hey, looking at Monica in her dress, it reminds me of all those bride parts you could play with that baby bump. Could've been your ticket to another acting gig!

Oh Joey, you and your acting career! You're always thinking about the next role. But I must admit, it would be kind of amazing to play a pregnant bride. I'd even write a special "Smelly Cat" lullaby version for the role.
Hey, I'd watch that! And you know what... I gotta say, you standing there with Chandler and Monica—it's like it was meant to be. We all ended up where we were supposed to, huh?

Absolutely, Joey. It was like the stars aligned. After everything we've been through, I mean, wow, we really have been there for each other. Like a really weird, dysfunctional family that somehow works.
You got that right, Pheebs. Between your songs, my sandwiches, Ross's dinosaurs, Rachel's fashion stuff, and these two lovebirds getting hitched—Friends forever, huh?
Friends forever, Joey. As long as we live, there's no escaping it. Not that I'd ever want to. This is like, the best family ever.
Couldn't agree more. And hey, if any of you guys end up pregnant for real, you know who to call for babysitting duties! I'll teach the kid how to say "How you doin'?" before they can walk!
Joey, you'd be the best, goofiest uncle ever. But make sure to keep your "Days of Our Lives" drama away from the babies, okay? We don't want to scare them with Dr. Drake Ramoray's coma stories!
Ha, don't worry, I'll keep it all about the cartoons and foosball. So, should we grab a bite or something? This talk about weddings is making me hungry for some reason.
Definitely, Joey. And don't worry, I'll let you have your own plate. No sharing necessary.

role_info: From left to right are Monica Geller holding a baby, Joey Tribbiani behind her, Chandler Bing, Phoebe Buffay, Rachel Green and Ross Geller.
scene_info: Rose and Rachel's daughter Emma's first birthday party.

conversations.value: So, Phoebe, could this party BE any more filled with balloons?
It's like a clown's idea of heaven exploded in here. It's festive and slightly terrifying.
And look at Monica, you know, she's already got that 'I'm-the-best-mom' glow. She's just one homemade cupcake away from reaching peak mommy euphoria.
For sure. Emma's going to grow up thinking her mom is some kind of kitchen wizard. Which, let's face it, compared to me she kind of is.
And Joey, who knew that him standing quietly behind Monica could make him look so... contemplative. Is he actually thinking, or is he just trying to remember where he left his sandwich?
Knowing Joey, he's probably doing complex calculations about how many meatball subs he could fit into the apartment if we used the balloons as space savers.
He'd turn this place into a deli if it meant unlimited sandwiches. Look at Ross and Rachel with little Emma. That's going to be a heck of a story to tell her when she's older, huh?

Definitely. "Once upon a time, your daddy said the wrong name at the altar, and your mommy was a runaway bride... It all led to a birthday party full of love and questionable decorations." Classic fairy tale.
And hey, in that story, would Uncle Chandler be the sarcastic knight or the jester with commitment issues?
Knight, absolutely. But, like, a knight who makes the other knights laugh so much, they forget to go to battle.
I could live with that. And what about Aunt Phoebe, the... mystical sorceress with her own theme song about aromatic felines?
Obviously. And my powers would include singing lullabies that make grown-ups cry and laugh at the same time.
The world is definitely not ready for "Smelly Cat: The Lullaby".

role_info: From top to bottom are Ross Geller, Joey Tribbiani, Rachel Green and Phoebe Buffay.
scene_info: They are begging to let them in.

conversations.value: Oh my God, Phoebe, look at this picture! Do you remember this day? They were begging us to let them in. I can't believe I found this while cleaning out one of the old boxes.
Wow, that's a classic! Look at their faces, they're squished like those little kitties you see in the animal shelter windows.
Y'know I had to be the hostess that day, right? I couldn't just open the door immediately—I had the power, Phoebe, the power!
Sweetie, you're always the hostess. You revel in it like a... like a squirrel with a nut that's also a remote control that controls other squirrels. They look so desperate.
I think Ross actually tried offering to organize my kitchen cabinets if we let them in. I mean, as if I’d let anyone touch my kitchen!
Yeah, and Joey just wanted to know what we were eating. But wait, what was the actual reason why they were locked out? I mean, I know we were mad at them but...
It was because they wouldn't admit we were right. You remember the whole 'they don't know that we know they know we know'? It was during that whole crazy fiasco.
Right! That was like a spy movie but with more sandwiches and fewer gadgets... though, definitely with the same amount of eavesdropping.
And Rachel! Look at her, pretending to be all innocent. As if she hadn't plotted the whole scheme with me.
It was a beautiful moment of female bonding. Plus, we got to see Chandler try that puppy eye thing he does, which, you know, is kinda cute, but definitely not as cute as he thinks.
I know! But hey, I wouldn't change a thing about that day. It's these ridiculous moments that always remind me why I love you guys so much.
Totally. It's like this weird, dysfunctional family portrait. I wouldn't hang it over my fireplace, but I'd definitely keep it in my sock drawer for a giggle.

role_info: From left to right are Chandler Bing on the phone, Ross Geller and Joey Tribbiani.
scene_info: They are persuading Chandler to resign, but he gets a higher paying job instead.

conversations.value: Oh my God, Phoebe, look at Chandler on the phone. He always gets that intense look when he's negotiating something big. What do you think he's talking about?
I bet he's ordering pizza, but like, for a whole army. You know, because Joey looks seriously interested, and you only see that when food's involved.
True, but remember when Chandler was all worried about having to quit his job? Maybe he's talking to his boss. And there's Ross, looking all supportive with that banana.
You know what? Maybe the banana is like a symbol, and Ross is subconsciously telling Chandler, "Life is full of slips and peels, but just take a bite and savor the good stuff."
Haha, Pheebs, you always find the deeper meaning in the weirdest things! But now I think about it, they do all look kind of tense. Do you think something's gone wrong?

Well, if something were wrong, Joey would be eating chicken. Chicken is his crisis food. Bananas are more like "I'm pondering my life choices" food. So, I think they're just in serious-grown-up decision-making mode.
Huh, that makes sense. I know we're just guessing here, but I hope Chandler doesn't end up doing something he regrets, the world of finance can be so cold. I mean, it's nothing like fashion!
Totally. I think no matter what, we should just be there for him. Like, if he does quit, we'll throw him a "You're free!" party, and if not, well, we'll just get him a cactus or something.
A cactus?
Yeah! It's like saying, "You may have to deal with pricks at work, but you've got a point too. Also, you don't need to water it much, so it's low commitment."
Phoebe, only you could come up with something like that. I love it. Let's definitely do that.

role_info: From left to right are Emily in a wedding dress, godfather and Ross Geller.
place_info: Ross and Emily's wedding in London
scene_info: Ross mistakenly calls his fiancée Emily Rachel.

conversations.value: Oh my God, Phoebe, do you remember this? Ross's wedding in London, and the moment when he said Rachel's name instead of Emily's!
Yeah, I mean, how could anyone forget that? It was like one of those moments that you just know is gonna be historic. And not in a good way.
I can't even imagine what was going through Emily's mind. I mean, if Chandler ever said another woman's name at the altar... I'd probably clean him out of existence!

Totally, she looked like she was in shock. You know, if it were me, I might have used my powers for evil just that once. Maybe haunt Ross with chants of "You said the wrong naaame" in an eerie voice for like... eternity.

Ha! You and your powers. Oh, look at her dress though, Pheebs. It was gorgeous, right? So classic and elegant. She really did look like a fairy tale princess—well, until the prince turned into a frog.
Absolutely. She was a vision. I sometimes wonder if things would've turned out differently if I had gone to London. Maybe my positive energy could've steered Ross's brain in the right direction.
Or at least, you could've used that energy to push him off course when he started veering towards "Rachel". Remember? "I, Ross, take thee Rachel"... Yikes, that still hurts.
I know. And the way everyone's head just snapped! It was like a tennis match with one very, very bad serve.
Honestly, I commend Emily for even going through with the marriage. Not saying that it lasted, but wow, that takes guts.
Yeah, she's like an English rose. An English rose that got stepped on... But still, a rose.
And poor Ross, I mean, it's so him to get caught up in something like this. Life's never dull with my brother around!
No kidding. Remember that? With my guitar in Central Perk, I should've written a song about it. "I mistakenly take thee Rachel" would've been a hit!

role_info: From left to right are Chandler Bing and Ross Geller.
scene_info: They tried to act cool on Thanksgiving Day during college.

conversations.value: Phoebe, check out this old picture of Chandler and me at my parents' house. Can you believe we thought we looked cool?
Oh wow, yeah. You guys look... super confident. Is that hair gel, or did a turkey baster do something funky?
Ha, very funny. It was the style back then, okay? Plus, it was Thanksgiving, we wanted to impress.
Impress? Who were you trying to attract, the turkey? Because it looks like your hair was its mating call.
No, it was college! We were trying to be all suave for... actually, I don't even remember who we were trying to impress.
Maybe it was the spirit of Thanksgiving past, telling you that one day, you guys would have amazing hair. Like future hair enlightenment.
Okay, you know what? I deserve that. And hey, my hair wasn't all bad. It was the '80s, it was a different time!
Oh sure, and mousse was everyone's best friend. But you look happy, Ross. Like you had no idea of the divorces lurking around the corner. Too dark?
Phoebe, only you could turn a walk down memory lane into a booby-trap. But, yeah, ignorance was bliss!
And now? You're wiser, right? Evolved. Like the dinosaurs you love so much, but with feelings!
Absolutely! Evolved, with feelings, and significantly less hair product. Thanks for that, Phoebe.
No problem! But you know, if it weren't for this picture, we wouldn't have this beautiful moment, so Thanksgiving miracle?
Alright, let's call it a Thanksgiving miracle. Thanks, Phoebs.
You're welcome! Just imagine, one day we'll be looking at pictures from now and laughing just as much. Because who knows what we're doing wrong this very second?
I guess that's what makes memories so special. It's like time travel but with more embarrassing hairstyles.
Exactly! So hold on to your hair gel, Ross. It's the portal to our past!

role_info: From left to right are Phoebe Buffay, Rachel Green, Chandler Bing and Monica Geller. Joey Tribbiani is in the sand in front.

conversations.value: Okay, could Joey BE any more of a beach bum? I mean, who else would think burying themselves in sand indoors is a good idea?
It's totally a Joey thing. He's one with the sand now. Maybe he's evolving – you know, like a Pokémon but less scales and more, um, sandwiches.
And look at Ross, as vigilant as ever. It's like he's guarding the Golden Gate Bridge, but instead of cars, it's just... grains of sand.
Haha, yeah, and with Rachel and Monica standing there, it's like they're all in some weird indoor beach crime procedural. "CSI: Living Room."
Which would make Joey the victim, the suspect, and the entire crime scene?
Exactly! That's talent. Only Joey could pull off such a complex role.
So if Joey's the crime scene, can I be the wise-cracking detective who makes sarcastic comments at inopportune times?
Definitely. And I'll be the psychic consultant who senses that the spirit of the ancient beach gods is like, totally upset about this indoor sand situation.
You know, if we start a beach inside, Monica is going to kill us – bury our bodies in sand and then vacuum around us meticulously.
But on the upside, we’d have beachfront property, right? And I could finally get that message in a bottle I've been waiting for!

role_info: From left to right are Rachel Green, Phoebe Buffay and Monica Geller.
scene_info: Phoebe breaks up the fight between the two.

conversations.value: Wow, remember this day? That's one intense memory right there. I mean, look at the tension between Rachel and Monica.
Oh yeah, I was totally the peacekeeper. Like a referee in one of those, what do you call them, non-violent... pillow fights.
Ha, yeah, Phoebe, I think what you were doing was a little more critical than managing a pillow fight. What was the fight about again? It looks pretty serious.

It was one of those classic mix-ups. Monica was getting super competitive as usual, and Rachel just wasn't having it. But don't worry, I channeled my inner 'Regina Phalange,' and I resolved the conflict with my diplomatic charm.
Diplomatic charm? If I recall correctly, didn't you threaten to sing "Smelly Cat" in operatic style until they stopped?
Yeah, well, sometimes the threat of a powerful song is all the diplomacy you need, Ross.
I guess that's one way to break up a fight. But really, Phoebe, you've always had a knack for bringing us back down to Earth. Like, you do it in the most unorthodox ways, but it works every time.
Aww, that's sweet, Ross. Like gravity, I'm an undeniable force of nature. And hey, look at the bright side, no dinosaurs were harmed in the making of this peace treaty.
True, no dinosaurs. But my money would have been on Rachel. She's gotten surprisingly scrappy living in the city.
Totally, but don't count Monica out. Remember, she has that hidden strength. Like an ant...or one of those super sponges that expands in water.
I remember. I grew up with Monic-ant.
Sibling humor—I dig it. You and your paleontology puns, Ross. Always a hit.
Speaking of digging, seeing this photo really digs up a lot of fond memories. Despite all the craziness, we had some really good times in that apartment.
Absolutely, it's where we all grew into this weird, wonderful family. Speaking of which, have you called your sister recently? I bet Monica-ant would love a buzz from her big bro.
You know what, I haven't. I'll give her a call. And hey, Phoebe, next time you play referee, maybe bring a whistle. You can start a new trend.
Oh my God, yes! Referee Phoebe with a whistle—that's a whole character waiting to unfold. Thanks for the inspiration, Ross!
Anytime, Phoebe. Anytime.

role_info: From left to right are Joey Tribbiani and Chandler Bing.

conversations.value: Could this BE any more of a deserted island situation? I mean, if the island was, say, an apartment and the ocean was, um, a dirty carpet?
I see what's happened here. It's like when I lived on the street, except you guys have a ceiling... and walls... and a canoe. Why do you have a canoe?
You know, because when you think about essentials in a living space, nothing screams necessity like nautical equipment. But hey, I think it really ties the room together, don't you?
It's certainly a conversation starter. Like, "Hey, where's all your furniture?" and you're like, "Shhh, just get in the boat."
I always enjoy a good furniture heist followed by aquatic role-play. And to think, Joey wanted to play 'Pirates', but now we get to play 'Two guys and a maybe imaginary tide'.
Well, now you can have boat adventures without ever leaving home. Imagine all the sea shanties you could write! Hey, how about "Smelly Couch, Smelly Couch, why were they taking you?"

That is so Phoebe. Musician by day, furniture-themed lyricist by... also day. Speaking of which, we've got some dinner reservations tonight, and it looks like the dress-code is... casual castaway chic?
You could always tell the maître d' you're embarking on a new trend: minimalism, but with an avant-garde twist. Call it the 'Empty Space Experience'.
Brilliant. Let's just hope they don't seat us next to a potted plant, or Joey might try to make a sail out of the tablecloth again.

role_info: From left to right are Chandler Bing and Monica Geller.

conversations.value: Wow. Look at this photo of Monica and Chandler's wedding. I still can't believe my little sister is married. She looks so beautiful, doesn't she?
She absolutely does. It's like she's a princess from one of those stories where they don't chop off your feet to make the shoe fit.

You have such a unique way of putting things, Phoebe. And Chandler—can you believe this guy? My best friend and my sister are husband and wife. It's like when two of your favorite dinosaurs become fossilized together, and you find them millions of years later.

Ross, only you would think about fossils at a wedding. But it's sweet, I guess, like a love that's been preserved in amber. You know, like in that movie with the—oh, what do you call it? Not the "Jurassic Park"?
That's the one. And hey, that reminds me, have I ever told you about the time I thought of the idea for "Jurassic Park"?
Only like a billion times, Ross. But every time you tell it, there's this twinkle of passion in your eyes, like the twinkle in Monica's eye right there in the photo. They're really happy together.
Yes, they are. And I'm glad that we can all be happy for them. And I'm really glad that Chandler didn't end up in Yemen for this.

Yemen, oh my God, that would have just been the worst destination wedding location. No offense to Yemen, of course. But imagine Monica having to organize a wedding there. It'd be mayhem—and not the fun kind, like a Smelly Cat concert mayhem.
Speaking of concerts, didn't you sing at their wedding? That "The Odd Couple" theme song rendition was—uh, classic Phoebe.

Classic Phoebe, indeed. I have to say though, in all of my performances, singing at their wedding was one of the times where I felt like my music was part of something bigger. I think I might have even seen a few people cry—unless they were just cringing, which is also possible.

No, no, I'm sure they were tears of joy. You have a way of moving people, Phoebe. Just like how this picture—you know, it moves me. It encapsulates so much about who we are as a group: the love, the friendship, and how we're all there for each other... even when we're all so different.
That's really sweet, Ross. We are quite a motley crew. Oh, I think I just found our next group Halloween costume!
Ha! Yes, I can see it now, "The Ross-tley Crew." But in all seriousness, this photo, this moment, it's going to be one for the history books—or at least, the Geller family album.
And speaking of things that last forever, doesn't seeing them together give you the nudge about you and Rachel? I mean, c'mon Ross, you love her!
Phoebe, that whole situation is... complicated. But yes, it does make me think about us. Life's full of these significant moments, and I guess, well, maybe we're just on a break from ours right now.
Ross, you and your "breaks." Maybe one day, you'll pivot that concept into something more permanent. Who knows?
Pivot, right, I’ll—uh, I'll work on that. Thanks, Phoebe.

role_info: From left to right are Mike, Rachel Green(bridesmaids) and Phoebe Buffay.

conversations.value: Whoa, look at this, Pheebs! Remember this day? You looked like one of those beautiful princesses outta the storybooks.
Aww, thanks Joey! That's so sweet. Yeah, I felt like a princess in a fairy tale, except without the scary forest and the evil witch.
And Mike's the prince, right? Wait, does that make us the quirky animal sidekicks?
Haha, for sure! You could be, like, a charming penguin and I... oh wait, I'm the princess, so no animal sidekick for me!
A penguin, huh? I like the tuxedo part, but they're not known for their meat-eating skills. How about a lion? They’ve got those too in fairy tales, right?
Sure, the king of the jungle! And lions are so brave, just like you were when you went to that audition for the musical, even though you don't sing.
Haha, yeah! That was a total 'Joey doesn't share food' kinda situation, except with singing. Speaking of food, do you remember the cake at your wedding? So good!
Totally! The cake was amazing. The whole wedding was just like I imagined—whimsical and fun, but still really special and meaningful.
Absolutely it was. And you and Mike, you guys just glowed. Not like, you know, actual glowing. Well, maybe a little in the happiness sense.
Joey, you’re such a sweetheart. You always know how to make me laugh and feel loved. Thanks for being there for us.
Hey, what are friends for, right? Besides, who else would I get to eat good food with and watch bad movies, if not my pals?
And don’t forget performing my "Smelly Cat" song!
How could I forget? That song's a classic. You got any new tunes in the works, or is it all about 'playing in the snow' with Mike these days?
I've got some new songs brewing. And, by the way, 'playing in the snow' is not a euphemism, but I love how your mind works, Joe. Always focused on the important stuff.
That's me! Gotta keep an eye out for the next big sandwich, or... song hit. Just keep on being you, Pheebs. The world definitely needs more Phoebe Buffay magic.
Aww, and it needs more Joey Tribbiani charm. How about we go grab a bite and reminisce some more about the good old days?
You had me at 'grab a bite'. Let's do it!

role_info: From left to right are Ross Geller, Chandler Bing, Monica Geller and Phoebe Buffay.

conversations.value: Oh my God, Phoebe, look at this! Can you believe we got ourselves into another sneaking situation like this? I feel like I'm in a spy movie... except there's no way we won't get caught with Ross's "I-cannot-tell-a-lie" face on display.

Definitely. And Chandler's trying so hard to look inconspicuous that it's just... incredibly conspicuous. It's like they're not even familiar with the basic tenets of eavesdropping. You know, you have to blend in with your surroundings, become one with the wallpaper.
Exactly! I feel like if this were a competition, we would totally win. I mean, look at us; we're practically invisible.

Well, I don't know about invisible. I mean, your dress is pretty eye-catching, Mon. It's a good thing though, because I read somewhere that zebra patterns can confuse predators. Completely applies in this case.
Phoebe, we are not zebras, and they are not predators. We just need to listen in without being spotted. My eyes are almost cramping from trying to notice everything without moving my head.

Yeah, my neck does feel a bit like it's being strangled by an invisible boa constrictor. Hey, maybe we should have a signal for when it's time to abort the mission. What about a bird call? I can do a mean pigeon.
No bird calls, Pheebs. Remember the last time we tried signals? I ended up with a tray of drinks on my head because Joey thought "flamingo" meant "party time."
True, but your hair acted like a protective canopy. You know, nature's umbrella.
Let's just try to focus on the task at hand, okay? And maybe move a little to the left; you're totally blocking my spy line.
Spy line? Monica, is that a thing now? Because I love it. It sounds so... undercover.
Yes, it's a thing. Now, shh! I think they're talking about us.

role_info: From left to right are Rachel Green and Ross Geller.
scene_info: Ross and Rachel meet for the first time awkwardly.

conversations.value: Look at Ross with that umbrella. Could he BE any more awkward?
I know, right? But, it's also kind of sweet in a weird, Ross-like majestic way.
Majestic? Really, Phoebs? If tripping over an umbrella is majestic, then I'm the next Prince of Wales.
Well, every prince needs his princess, and look at Rachel. She could totally pass for royalty in that wedding dress.
Yeah, if the royal family decided to hold ceremonies in a coffee house. Which, by the way, is an excellent idea. Note to self – suggest coffee houses as royal wedding venues.
I can totally see it now. "Sir Chandler Bing proposes a new era of royal caffeination!"

I like the sound of that. Sir Chandler has a nice ring to it... Wait, why are we not talking about the fact that Rachel just barged in here in a wedding dress? That's not your everyday Central Perk entertainment.
That's true. But then again, this is Friends, and we're not exactly your everyday kind of pals. We kind of set the bar high for dramatic entrances.
Speaking of high bars, I bet Ross is wishing he could raise that umbrella without bringing the whole place down with him.
Aww, give him a break. This is like the universe giving Ross a second chance at love. It's like when I found that stray cat and thought it was my mom reincarnated.
Right... because finding your long-lost love is exactly like adopting a stray cat.
You get it, Chandler! Love, stray cats... it's all about second chances and, you know, the surprising joy of the unexpected.
Surprising? Yes. Joy? I guess we'll have to wait and see how Ross handles the whole rainy-day-meet-cute scenario.
He'll be fine. As long as he doesn't pivot with the umbrella, everything should be great.
Pivot. Classic Ross. And here we are, witnessing the beginning of a saga that will span a decade, filled with 'will they, won't they,' and... more pivoting.

role_info: From left to right are Ross's Chinese girlfriend, Ross Geller, Chandler Bing, Rachel Green and Monica Geller.
scene_info: Ross introduces his Chinese girlfriend to everyone.

conversations.value: Look at that! Ross is with his new girlfriend. That's gotta be kind of weird, right?
Yeah, especially since she's standing like a statue. Look at her, so still; she's like a pretty ninja.
Ha! Ninja, good one, Pheebs. But hey, Ross looks a little uneasy, don't cha think?
Absolutely, it's like he just realized he forgot to learn Chinese.
And Chandler, man, what's with that expression? It looks like he's trying to solve a complicated math problem... And we all know how that would go for me!
Joey, he's just being Chandler. And look at Rachel, all classy and fashion-y as always.
Yeah, Rachel definitely knows how to dress. And Monica's like, "I'm Monica, I'm domestic, look at my kitchen full of shiny things."
Speaking of shiny, do you think they polished that fridge just for Ross's girlfriend? She's standing so close to it, after all.
Maybe, but if anyone's gonna notice a shiny fridge, it's Monica. I bet she screens people's reflections to see if they're stealing cookies.
Ha! Well, Joey, you would definitely get caught. Remember that time with the cheesecake?
Hey, a cheesecake's gotta be eaten, otherwise it's just wasteful.
True, very true. But back to Ross's introduction ceremony, do you think we should get them a gift, like a "Welcome to the group" mug or something?
Sure, as long as we don't have to chip in. You know, Joey doesn't share... expenses!
Joey, never change.
